page.title: 13Barnston, Lt Dunmow, Felsted
page.content:
Since the closure of the railway between Braintree and Bishop's Stortford, in 1952, public transport in and around the villages of Barnston, Little Dunmow and Felsted has consisted of a limited bus service, and the majority of people rely on private cars for transport, and to a lesser extent on motor or pedal cycles.
Children living over a three mile radius from their schools are transported by buses provided by the Education Authority.
All industrial and commercial goods are carried by lorries or vans.
